author: Corey Fuller
title: Sarò in grado di vedere l’aurora boreale anche stasera a New York? (10/11)
text:
Se vi trovate nell’ area di New York o del New Jersey (o se siete stati sui social media nelle ultime 24 ore) avrete probabilmente visto l’incredibile quantità di post relativi allo spettacolo dell’aurora boreale di ieri sera (10 ottobre).
Incredibili foto di aurore boreali , o aurora boreale, si sono riversate ieri sera da Long Island al New Jersey, fino ad Astoria, nel Queens!
Grazie alla cosiddetta tempesta geomagnetica , un’importante perturbazione della magnetosfera terrestre che si verifica quando c’è un efficiente scambio di energia dal vento solare all’ambiente spaziale che circonda la Terra.
Molti di noi fortunati newyorkesi hanno potuto vedere le incredibili sfumature di viola e verde senza dover viaggiare!
Instagram / @kingy27nyc Riuscirò a vederla di nuovo stasera a New York? Sì ! Secondo lo Storm Prediction Center della NOAA , l’aurora boreale dovrebbe essere visibile anche stasera a New York e nelle zone circostanti !
A che ora posso vedere l’aurora boreale a NYC stasera? Dovreste essere in grado di vedere l’aurora boreale a New York e nel New Jersey, subito dopo il tramonto e fino all’alba di sabato mattina !
Il tramonto di stasera a New York è intorno alle 18.20, mentre l’alba di domani, sabato mattina, è intorno alle 7.05.
Perché l’aurora boreale è visibile a New York? L’aurora boreale è visibile a New York a causa di un disturbo unico nella magnetosfera terrestre chiamato tempesta geomagnetica .
In questo caso, un’espulsione di massa coronale dal Sole (un’enorme raffica di venti solari e campi magnetici) è entrata nel campo magnetico del pianeta, facendola collidere con le particelle già presenti nella nostra atmosfera.
Quando tutte le particelle si scontrano, emettono luce… con colori straordinari: verde, viola, rosso e blu, a seconda del tipo di elementi che si scontrano!
Di conseguenza, le sfumature di colore sono visibili anche a occhio nudo!

author: Eloísa Machado
title: PL do Estuprador não é só ruim na índole, é na técnica, diz jurista
text:
Só para assinantes Assine UOL Opinião 'PL do Estuprador' não é só ruim na índole, é ruim na técnica, diz jurista Eloísa Machado Professora da FGV Direito SP, membro da Comissão Arns e do Coletivo de Advogado em Direitos Humanos 13/06/2024 18h47
O PL do Estuprador ou PL da Gravidez Infantil, como ficou conhecido o projeto de lei número 1904/2024, vai tramitar em regime de urgência na Câmara dos Deputados - o que significa dizer que irá para votação no plenário, sem qualquer debate em qualquer comissão.
Não houve sequer informação clara de que o requerimento de urgência desta matéria estaria em análise. Segundos bastaram para avançar com o retrocesso. A votação relâmpago conduzida pelo presidente Arthur Lira (PP-AL) é a cara da Câmara: descomprometida com o interesse público, debochada e com uma pitada de mutreta.
Não bastasse os evidentes problemas de processo legislativo, o PL do Estuprador é ruim de doer. Ruim na técnica e na índole.
Letícia Casado
Câmara usa aborto para dar resposta a Moraes
Reinaldo Azevedo
Projeto de Sóstenes é teste de captura das instituições
Carolina Brígido
Caso Marielle terá semana crucial no STF
Juca Kfouri
Flamengo alternativo também é muito forte
1) O projeto impõe tempo limite para a interrupção da gestação em casos de estupro e risco de vida da gestante, além de propor pena à vítima. Ao fazer isso, ignora completamente os dados: seis em cada dez mulheres estupradas são crianças e 70% é estuprada em casa, por pais, padrastos, tios, avôs. Saber isso faz toda diferença: impor limite temporal para acessar serviço de saúde no caso de estupro é jogar o tempo contra a vítima. Por isso o apelido de PL da Gravidez Infantil.
2) A criança tem que superar, muitas vezes sozinha, o desafio de denunciar o "homem da casa". Além disso, ela custa a ser acreditada. Não bastasse, precisa estar acompanhada de um responsável para acessar o serviço de saúde, torcendo para que uma turba de fanáticos não impeça seu acesso ao hospital. Precisa ainda contar com um profissional de saúde que não desonre a profissão e resolva colocar empecilhos descabidos: fazê-la ouvir ultrassom, registro de B.O., autorização do estuprador.
Se o médico colocar empecilhos ilegais, a criança ainda vai precisar contar com um promotor que não use o cargo para impor suas convicções acima da lei e com um juiz que não pense ser o bispo. Por isso a demora em conseguir acesso a um serviço de aborto legal. Por isso os fanáticos querem ter poder sobre o tempo.
3) Como se já não fosse suficiente, a ruindade moral do projeto, há um requinte de crueldade na pena prevista para a vítima de estupro que interromper a gestação acima do prazo estipulado: bem maior que a do estuprador. Por isso a alcunha de PL do Estuprador. O relator do projeto disse que é tudo para testar os compromissos de Lula com a bancada evangélica. Usa a dor de crianças como uma barganha barata.
4) Barata não, cara. Pois é sobre misoginia, é sobre perversidade (parte dessa turma tem como heróis um coronel estuprador), mas é também sobre dinheiro, sobre muito dinheiro. A moeda de troca por mais emendas parlamentares e pelo controle do orçamento em ano eleitoral é a dignidade de crianças. Não honram as calças que usam, compradas com os penduricalhos que pagamos.
Desprendido da realidade, da Constituição e do interesse público, um Legislativo que pensa apenas na própria sobrevivência a custa da dor de crianças, não merece respeito, nem deferência, nem reeleição.

author: Celine Wicks In Our Schools
title: In Our Schools: Student corresponds with President Biden, fifth-grade adventures, academic success and more
text:
Last year, Skyler Kling, a sixth-grade social studies and language arts teacher at Steamboat Springs Middle School, had her students conduct a research project on how the environment shapes culture.
After the research, Kling challenged her students to conduct a “Call to Action” and write a letter to an organization related to their research and cause. Owen David went right to the top and sent a letter to President Biden regarding the importance of incorporating more culture into schools. As a result, Owen received correspondence from President Biden.
Dear Owen,
Thank you for sharing your thoughts with me. Vice President Harris and I love hearing from students. Even at your age, you have the power to change the future and make history.
Our country faces many challenges, and the work we have ahead of us is going to be really tough. I’m certain that if we set aside our differences and come together as a Nation, we will make positive change. It won’t be easy, and I’m going to need your help.
I urge you to remain curious, creative, and fearless. Students like you are the future of our great Nation, and it’s important that you speak up on issues that matter most. When you make your voice heard, adults listen.
I wish you the best in the years ahead, and I look forward to seeing where your future takes you. Study hard. Keep challenging yourself. And be kind.
Sincerely, Joe Biden
Owen said he wasn’t expecting to get a response from President Biden but was excited and proud of himself when he did. He wants more celebrations of culture around the U.S., especially in schools and the letter encouraged him to keep pursuing his cause. The letter is now framed and prominently displayed in Owen’s house.
SPE fifth-grade camping trip Fifth-grade students from Strawberry Park Elementary work together to navigate a ropes course during a recent field trip to Snow Mountain Ranch. Steamboat Springs School District/Courtesy photo Fifth graders at Strawberry Park Elementary recently had a fantastic trip to Snow Mountain Ranch. This was an incredible learning experience and a chance to connect and build trust and community with their classmates.
The students worked together to set up their own tents, practice “Leave No Trace” principles and challenge themselves on the low ropes course. Students learned about being independent and responsible and how to lean on each other when needed.
The trip would not have been possible without the support of Assistant Principal Jaime Passchier, Strawberry Park fifth-grade teachers and all the families and parent chaperones. Thank you to all those who supported the event, giving their time and energy to support the students.
Students from Strawberry Park Elementary enjoy working on projects during a recent trip to Snow Mountain Ranch. Steamboat Springs School District/Courtesy photo SSMS School Accountability Committee recruitment SSMS is looking for a couple parents to join the School Accountability Committee for the upcoming school year. More information is provided through the CDE Guidelines for SAC and DAC . The SAC meets four times a year from 4-5:15 p.m. This year’s dates are Oct. 1, Jan. 28, March 4 and May 6. Please contact Principal Chapman-Hoy at hchapman-hoy@ssk12.org by Sept. 23 if you are interested in this opportunity.
Janet Peasley honored with Visionary Leadership Award Congratulations to Janet Peasley, our district-wide gifted and talented coordinator who has been selected to receive the 2024 Jacquelin Medina Visionary Leadership Award from the Colorado Association for Gifted and Talented.
This is special recognition of her dedication and efforts in the name of gifted students and their families. The award honors leadership action in schools, districts and at the state level for the benefit of gifted students and their families. Congratulations, Janet!
District excels in statewide assessments The Steamboat Springs School District has demonstrated strong academic performance, earning an overall Accredited rating based on district and school performance frameworks from the Colorado Department of Education. SSSD earned 73 out of 100 points on the performance framework, just shy of the Accredited with Distinction rating (74-plus points).
SSSD elementary and middle schools achieved Distinction ratings for exceptional Academic Growth and Academic Achievement by earning Meets Expectations on those indicators. Also, SSSD middle school students earned Exceeds Expectations in English language arts and math. SSSD high school students received the Accredited ranking overall. They earned a Meets Expectation on Postsecondary Readiness and Academic Achievement and an Approaching Expectations on Academic Growth.
For more information, read the full story on SSSD’s website.
Update on affordable housing
We are committed to addressing the affordable housing needs of Steamboat Springs School District staff and want to update you on recent developments.
We recently secured a Department of Local Affairs grant to assist in creating a request for proposals for affordable housing. However, as of Aug. 30, the Colorado Division of Housing has issued a stop-work order on this technical assistance due to state budget issues. This pause is beyond our control.
While unsure how long the stop-work order will last, we are exploring alternative options, including developing on property owned by Steamboat Springs School District next to Sleeping Giant School. We are collaborating with Paul Major from Rural Homes Colorado to evaluate the sites, and we expect the results in late October or early November.
These findings will help us assess the feasibility of potential affordable housing on these properties. Additionally, we will carefully consider all options regarding the Whistler Park property as part of our broader efforts to address these housing challenges after receiving the final feasibility study from Rural Homes Colorado.
Celine Wicks is the superintendent for the Steamboat Springs School District.

author: Damien Gozioso
title: Affaire Bétharram : un diacre suspendu par l'évêque de Tarbes et Lourdes
text:
Affaire Bétharram : un diacre suspendu par l'évêque de Tarbes et Lourdes
Un diacre ayant affirmé cette semaine avoir frappé des élèves à Notre-Dame-de-Bétharram lorsqu'il y était surveillant, entre 1979 et 1981, a été suspendu de ses fonctions par Jean-Jacques Micas, l'évêque de Tarbes et Lourdes.
Jean-Jacques Micas, l'évêque de Tarbes et Lourdes à écrit vendredi une lettre aux prêtres, diacres et laïques du diocèse pour les prévenir de la suspension d'un diacre, qui dans un reportage à la télé ces derniers jours, s'était vanté d'avoir frappé des élèves à Bétharram : "Quand je frappais, je frappais (...) En début d'année, il fallait en distribuer quelques-unes, puis après c'était tout, je n'avais pas besoin d'en redistribuer", avait-il déclaré mercredi sur TF1. Ce diacre, actuel maire de Jarret près de Lourdes, a été surveillant à Notre-Dame de Bétharram entre 1979 et 1981.
Suspendu "jusqu'à nouvel ordre"
"Depuis quelques jours, Ange Mur, diacre de notre diocèse depuis 1992, est impliqué dans le dossier de l'institution Notre-Dame-de-Bétharram, pour des faits de violence sur des élèves alors qu'il y était surveillant de 1979 à 1981", écrit Jean-Marc Micas, évêque de Tarbes et Lourdes. "Depuis son ordination diaconale, Ange Mur, enseignant, a été animateur pastoral, engagé auprès des chrétiens en monde rural, en Action catholique et au service de paroisses. Dès que j'ai appris son implication, je lui ai retiré tout ministère de manière conservatoire", ajoute-t-il. Il "est suspendu jusqu'à nouvel ordre", a précisé le diocèse à l'AFP.

author: Facility Executive
title: Delaware State University Adds AI Gun Detection Technology
text:
Delaware State University, an HBCU (Historically Black Colleges and Universities) located in Dover, Delaware, recently integrated ZeroEyes’ AI gun detection technology and situational awareness platform into its multi-layered security system. The project was facilitated by Delaware-based Advantech.
Delaware State University (DSU) is a public university dedicated to providing quality education, research, and service. Established in 1891, DSU offers a diverse range of undergraduate and graduate programs and fostes academic excellence and community engagement.
“I’m always looking for the most innovative technology to assist us in preventing and solving crime, and maintaining a feeling of safety for our community,” said James Overton, superintendent at DSU. “I knew ZeroEyes’ gun detection technology was good, but the human element behind it, which minimizes false positive detections, convinced me that this was a serious product capable of mitigating false alarms and preventing harm.”
Advantech is a global leader in embedded and automation solutions for AIoT system integrators. The company has built a reputation in the education sector, serving both K-12 and higher education institutions…
